Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in central hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a couple of nights towards the end of April and the hotel was brilliant. Our room was great, (room 201) and tucked away at the back of the building meant we both slept really well. The room was a good size and clean. The wide variety of food offered at breakfast set us both up nicely for two days of wandering around a beautiful city. Would definitely recommend staying here, you cannot ask for a better location or a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MitzyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived in Venice wondering how we would find this hotel. Fortunately an elderly gentleman rescued us and delivered us to the hotel. Not sure we would have found it as the entrance is just a door. Once inside we were made very welcome and spoken to in English. Our room was really two rooms and spacious. The bathroom was very tidy but small and a large person would not have fitted into the shower. Breakfast was on the top floor with roof top views. Lovely crockery too. Being 5 minutes from St Marks square was great. We took a city walk which helped us get our bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location-Few Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: nannerp
Reviews.Content: I wish we could add half "stars" as I would say that this hotel is a bit above average, but there were a few minor issues that would keep me from saying that it was great. The biggest positive is that you simply could not ask for a better location. It's about a 5 minute walk to both San Marco Square and the Rialto Bridge. The room itself was a tad small, but very attractive in terms of decor. The bathroom, however, was a bit too small. Because of the bidet placement, the door wouldn't open all the way and you literally had to squeeze between the door and the shower to get to the toilet. It wasn't a huge issue, but wasn't exactly ideal either. Our only other issue was that the room key had to be left at the front desk whenever you left and then you had to be buzzed back into the hotel. Generally this wasn't an issue, but there were at least two occasions where we had to wait outside about 10 minutes before someone let us back in. We prefer to have a bit more freedom in our ability to come and go. Apart from that, we did enjoy our stay. The value and location are good and we didn't regret our decision, but I doubt that I would stay with them again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sat 24th March. First impression was one of uncertainty as approach to Hotel & entrance not the most attractive BUT once entering the premises our concerns were very soon allayed. Friendly & efficient staff, good sized room that was clean and well equipped. Breakfast in the attic was different but fantastically quirky. Very well situated just 2 mins walk from Piazzo San Marco. Weather was perfect and most areas of Venice were within easy walkining distance. Last day meant and early departure. Staff organized an early morning call & an earlier than normal breakfast. Well done & mant thanks. The water taxi was an extra bonus. Left on 28th March, refreshed & very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: Rodney S
Reviews.Content: This is a small friendly hotel. We stayed for three nights - all of the staff were very friendly and competent and spoke very good English. The room was comfortable and clean a good size and with decent cotton sheets and towels. Breakfast was good. The hotel is very well placed for San Marco and Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Vetgirl2004
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, yet quiet in evenings for a good nights sleep. Staff very polite and helpful, had to change rooms on the first night but this was handled quickly and without problems. Room clean, spent most time out and about. Breakfast simple but adequate. Nearby Taverna San Lio is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Disey12
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Ca' del Campo Hotel in September 2011. This hotel is in a perfect position. So very close to St Mark's square. Walking around Venice was wonderful and this hotel is in such a central position. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. Service was exemplary. Breakfast is served in a quaint dining room and was of excellent standard.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem behind San Marco”
Reviews.Author: communicator1598
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located behind Piazza San Marco, and handy to most places. The hotel is on the upper floor of a renovated building, and is fully modern and tastefully decorated. A bonus was that our room overlooked the canal. There is a good continental breakfast, and the staff were very helpful with directions and with arranging water transportation to the railway station. Double glazed windows mean a quiet room, and a fully-equipped modern bathroom and central air conditioning added to the comfort. Even with the elevator, there are a few steps (less than 5) to navigate to reach reception on the second floor - important if stairs are a problem. And be sure to have an accurate, detailed map for find the hotel if you are coming from the vaporetti stop near San Marco or on foot. The hotel isn't far, but there are a few twists and turns in the narrow streets to navigate as you tote your luggage. (We found the street address wasn't enough for many locals to guide you.) If you are coming by water taxi, make sure it drops you at the canal dock a few feet from the door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Len-Sha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Del Campo for 4 nights from 7 till 11/12/2011 in a standard room on the third floor. Room was excellent spacious and furnishing modern and straight forward, also very well lit and airy, bathroom very functional with shower. Breakfast on the fourth floor very well lit with nice views, continental buffet including sliced ham, salamis and chesses. Yogurts, croissants and extremely helpful staff. Security with Safe and always controlled entry, clean and tidy. Reception staff including the management ready to assist at all times. Hotel is situated 5 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco and 10 minute walk from the Rialto. Also nearby very good restaurants to which all information and accurate directions was given to us by the reception staff at the Hotel. Would recommend the Hotel and looking forward to my next visit to Venice. Sharon and Len from Malta

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ogramrebecca
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located near the San Marco Square (3 min walk) and near plenty of shops. Breakfast room was bright and open and some rooms had canal views. Breakfast was decent and room was clean, but small. Only complaint was price was a bit high for what we got, but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jonnycarwash
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. We staying in room 3 right off the main lobby...it was a beautiful room with a view right on the canal and an amazing chandelier over the bed. We had a great and modern bathroom/shower and a wonderful night here. Its about 50 feet off the main path and does not have a big sign (so we DEFINITELY had a hard time finding it the first time) but its location is absolutely perfect and is only about 3 minutes from main areas for food, shopping, and sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: 60freedom
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellant , safe controlled entry , clean and tidy , with the staff very helpful . We enjoyed the breakfast room at the top . Great location to St Marks Square , which as noted by others, was handy for later nights in the square when most of the tourist crowd have vanished or in the day in a handy position to return to freshen up. It is also walking distance to Rialto Bridge and the ferries to the train station. This is the way we left Venice with an easy walk, with cases, to the Bridge ferry terminal early morning to pick up the ferry and then a train to Florence. If ever lucky enough to return would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent week stay...”
Reviews.Author: chomi
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for a week in month of May 2011, to celebrate out 10th wedding anniversary, and chose Ca'del Campo hotel, based on the reviews in Trip Advisor. We had a great time in Venice, part of which is this hotel. The hotel is, like all the buildings in Venice, is a historic, charming building but very modern and convenient inside. Our room was right behind the reception desk, facing the canal. The room was fairly sized, with all the amenities you would need. The bathrooms didn't have a bathtub (no big deal for us), but had a shower. The breakfast had ample choice, although after 5 days of stay, became a bit routine. The coffee was excellent (although the coffee flasks weren't ideal). The hotel staff always had a smile on their face, and were warm and friendly. The excellent part of this hotel is the location. There is nothing like spending later evenings and night in St.Marks square after all the tourist crowd's have vanished. We spent almost every night very late in St.Marks square, and would get back to hotel early morning 1-2 AM. The total walk is less than 2 minutes. Being a photographer, I would go before sunrise (and before the crowds) to get decent pictures of St.Marks square.Never did I felt unsafe walking with all that photogear late at night, partly I knew, I was not far away from my hotel. I have posted a link to pictures of my trip below. Its a 10 minute walk to Accamedia bridge, and 15 minute to Rialto bridge. Overall, this hotel complements your trip to Venice. This hotel is not a fancy 4 or 5 start hotel with amazing facilities, but a quiet, good, great value hotel, with EXCELLENT location to St.Marks square. We were very happy with this hotel, and was our "home" after long days walking around. Being a lover of afternoon siesta's, we would decide to go back and have a restful naps, to be ready for evening trips. One cannot beat the location of this one. When we go back next time to Venice, we know where we will stay again. Here is the link to pictures of our Venice trip: http://www.flickr.com/photos/somvembar/sets/72157626789969498/show/

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: krobe8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' del Campo for a week in October-2011, in a "superior double" room (#4). It was an excellent, very pleasant stay. The furnishings are straightforward, functional and first class -- not overdone. Room very well lit. Bathroom fixtures excellent -- shower only, no tub. Breakfast buffet was ample, including sliced meats and cheeses, yogurt. Hotel staff helpful with concert ticket arrangements, weather information, directions, and other assistance. Small hotel, about 20 rooms with staff of about 10 people. Location convenient to shops and sights. Comfortable chairs in lobby on 1st floor, good place for reading. Security good. I recommend Ca' del Campo without hesitation. Directions -- an amendment to information obtained from other TripAdvisor reviews: The directions from Piazza San Marco, referring to a McDonald's restaurant, are no longer valid as there is no longer a McDonald's at the Piazza (thank goodness!). Instead, the following from Google, worked well for me: From the Piazza, go under the clock (to left of the American Bar), on Manzaria de l'Orologio, about 100m, until you are about 10m before the red Ferrari store at the T-junction. Turn right onto Ramo San Zulian, and go 50m to the next T-junction. Turn left onto Calle Specchieri, go 10m, take the next right and you are on Campo de La Guerra. The hotel is on your right, about 30m along, before you reach the bridge. Press buzzer for the hotel and they will let you in. There are a few steps to go up, to get to the elevator, where you can lift your bags. The lobby is on the first floor, above the entrance and elevator. Also, directions from airport: Exit airport, follow sidewalk to the left, about 7 minutes towards the water landing -- symbol of wavy lines with a boat drawing, on the signs. The landing has water taxis, and also the Alilaguna boat line. The blue line boat is the one we were advised to take, although I think the orange line boat would also have gotten us to our stop. The best stop is San Marco, because from it there are no bridge steps to go up/down to reach the Piazza and the hotel. If you buy ticket for Alilaguna at the airport, it costs 15 Euro at the dispenser in the baggage claim. Or you can buy ticket on the boat, for 16 Euro. Other updated info: Internet now costs 3 Euro/half hour, not 5 Euro. There is a computer in the lobby, do not need your own computer to check email etc. Cheers, e buon viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glencor
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is definitely the highlight. 2 minutes walk to St Marks Square and restaurants on your doorstep. Lots of places to choose from for dinner and drinks in the evening. Great for popping back to for a break from the throngs of tourists. Hotel room was nice. Small but very clean with a fridge, good shower. Nice continental breakfast. Staff were friendly and very polite. Reception is on the 1st floor so hotel is a single door off the street and you buzz a bell to get in. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pamela H
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Nicola and Laura for all their help with tours, concerts, and transportation. The hotel is on a quiet street in the busy, busy San Marco area. Also, there are no bridges between the San Marco Allilaguna stop so it's easy to roll luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron K
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well run hotel close to the centre and easy access (once you get the hang of the narrow alleyways).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hotel to be recommended in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' del Campo at end of August/beginning of September. Visiting Venice for the first time and aware of the millions of visitors they see every year we were prepared for being treated like just another tourist. We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We couldn't have asked for a better location, just behind St. Mark's Square (when I called a couple of days before our trip the receptionist explained in detail exactly how to get from the airport to the hotel). All staff, from reception to breakfast room to cleaning staff were very helpful and polite. This is a small hotel but has a 24 hour reception desk, a good security/surveillance system (safe also in the rooms) and is kept very clean in all areas. The family rooms (for four) consist of two separate bedrooms/bathrooms with their own hall and entrance. The continental breakfast is good with fresh coffee, rolls, croissants, cheese/ham/yogurts etc. Reception recommends some great restaurants - we couldn't fault any of them - and even have a cabin for guests' use on Alberoni beach on the Lido which is worth a visit if you have younger children and you want to give them a break from visiting all the wonderful churches and art galleries! All in all our stay was really perfect thanks to Ca' del Campo and I don't hesitate in recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worthless...better go for others.”
Reviews.Author: Small_BuG_123
Reviews.Content: 1. Location - normal 2. room condition - normal 3. safe deposit- ask the key from the reception and maybe i am short, the safe is on top of the wardrobe that everytime i have to get a chair to climb up for the safe.... 4. room Key - Please surrender the room key to the reception otherwise they will change the door lock, and ....but its ok, pls refer no.7 below. 5. Lift - you must walk to level 1 everytime to collect / surrender the key (I think the lift at ground floor shall close down since it is useless) 6. Service - ....looks like very efficiency (i feel myself get surveilance, because they rush to my room when the locks changed...:) ....eventhough I just at the entrance of my room not more then 2 mins !! ) 7. Breakfast - very very "simple" 8. Room Toilet - sticky We spent 2 nights with the hotel in early sept 2011, and feel it doesnt worth to its value, and there are plenty of hotel in s.marco which is better location and value.

Reviews.Title: “One well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Nigel F
Reviews.Content: Ideally positioned close to St Mark's Square. A small hotel ideal for those who enjoy a quiet stay but still close to shops, bars and restaurants. Rooms very clean and comfortable decorated in a Venetian style which added to the pleasent ambience. Staff very helpful. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: psyied
Reviews.Content: We were only in venice for a day so we wanted to be in the heart of the city with access to everything. Ca'del campo was GREAT! AWESOME morning croissants and coffee, and is right in the heart of everything. There was no noise at night, the room was large, GREAT A/c, and VERY friendly staff! The only problem we had was trying to locate the hotel with a rudimentary map! Highly suggest getting a VERY detailed map in order to find your way.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: bradleynoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of everything, just a 5 minute walk from St Mark's Square and the Cathedral and Doges Palace. If you love music at night you can just walk down to the square and listen to what we call "the battle of the bands". In the square there are a few cafe's, each has a 4 or 5 piece orchestra and they take turns playing classical music. I warn you though, it's expensive. You pay to sit and you pay for the food. But, like it or not, this is Venice. Take your best credit card and bend over. :) You are here for the experience. This hotel is so sweet, it's a few hundred years old so don't expect to stay in a super modern Marriot. If you want history, ambiance, quaint surroundings then this is the place for you. The breakfast is simple but sufficient, once again; don't expect a Marriot style spread. There is a reason that europeans aren't all overweight, they eat simpley and they walk everywhere. :) They don't dive face first into a giant buffet and consume enough food to feed thousands. The staff here are helpful, there is internet in the lobby for a small cost and really nothing else to say.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: southwellingnanna
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel very easily after getting of private water taxi at San Marco, The hotel is near St Marks Square, and not far from Rialto Bridge,a perfect location for all the resturants and small bars,Check in was easy, Room was large and beautifully decorated, bathroom was also tastefully decorated the power shower was what was needed after a long hot day seeing all the sights, Breakfast was very good cold meat, cheeses, cerals, rolls,fresh fruites,yoghurts ect,did not have to worry about lunch.Staff was always helpful and the cleaners keep our room spotless,It was my husbands 60th birthday while we were there, the cleaner must have seen the card that I gave my husband,and told the front desk, when we had gone out for our evening meal we came back to find a bottle of champagne,this made my husbands birthday complete, this is what makes this hotel very special, they care about guests, we even had a problem with our return water taxi, they sorted everthing out for us.I would recommend this hotel very highly to all my family and friends. thank you ca'del campo for a special time

Reviews.Title: “Nothing terrible but we won't not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jsfisch
Reviews.Content: Good location and clean rooms but we found the front desk staff to be unhelpful and in cases inaccurate in their information. Upon check-in the young man couldn't give us a recommendation for dinner!! This is a vital service that we depend on everywhere we go. Another gentleman told us a vaporetto line was no longer running which proved to be incorrect and told us to use another line that didn't go where we wanted to. This hotel was the only one of our trip that charged for internet service, unnecessary in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in the middle of San Marco Venice”
Reviews.Author: RichandCarmen
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were very friendly and more than happy to help. The hotel is a nice boutique hotel its clean and just perfect for our stay in Venice. The breakfast was a nice continental breakfast with cold meats fresh fruit etc pefect to start the day off. We were only mins walk to San Marco plaza and Rialto bridge. Couldn't fault this hotel at all. Will stay here again if I visit venice again. WiFi wasn't free but was cheap and only used it once to check e-mails etc. Had a lovely stay thankyou. Will stay here again if I vist venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: slohnd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated less than 5 minutes walk from San Marco square. The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was typically European and was a great start to your day. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Solo Traveller”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers099
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for a solo traveller. I stayed for 4 nights. The hotel and my room were clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and I felt safe staying on my own. I had alerted the hotel ahead of time that I would be travelling on my own and they accommodated my needs appropriately. I would certainly stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: JeanieBlackburnLancs
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights in Venice and this small Hotel was perfect. Location is brilliant, very near St. Marks Square, small but rooms lovely, staff polite and helpful, quiet, breakfast good and nearby bars cheap and cheerful. We had the attic room it was brilliant and breakfast is served on two floors so no rush in the mornings and good service. The staff are all lovely and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBunny13
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lovely little hotel! Was in an excellent location only a couple of minutes from St Marks square. Very clean and excellent sized rooms. We had a lovely bathroom with a great power shower and constant hot water. Great airconditioning in the room too. Breakfast was just right- croissants, rolls, cereal, ham, cheese, salami, cake, juices tea and coffee- enough to set u up for the day! We stayed for 3 nights and would have happily stayed even longer. We would definitely go back. Concierge was helpful too with pointing us in the right direction. They even left us some breakfast (not the whole lot though) on out last morning as we were leaving very early for the airport. The only down side if there even was one was that we had 2 singles beds stuck together instead of a double bed but that was still fine. and Venice was absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly intimate, friendly and quiet city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanf70
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this well-appointed, friendly small hotel. The room was, like the whole hotel, recently decorated, clean and comfortable - and everything worked! Service was friendly (we got wellington boots the night we arrived, to cope with an 'acqua alta') and helpful. Breakfast was in an intimate, pleasant room. The only thing we were rather disappointed with was the coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Venice”
Reviews.Author: GAZBOW
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice second week of May 2011, as a birthday surprise for my wife. We eventually found the hotel after being dropped off by water taxi at St Mark's Sq, actually quite a good location for sight seeing, restaurants etc. The hotel itself would border 4 star quality, cleanliness, professional and helpful front desk (actually on 1st floor! ) and delightful and bright breakfast room on 4th floor, with standard continental breakfast to set you up for the day. The rooms were clean and tidy (we had quite a good room, 2 bedrooms and decent sized bathroom, over looking the alley way between the 2 parts of hotel.) Would I book Ca'del Campo again? - most definitly.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in San Marco area”
Reviews.Author: NigriParis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the Piazza San Marco area and, although close to the busiest parts of Venice, is perfectly protected from all possible noise. Hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly, assisting me in every single need. Rooms are charming and comfortable. Overall, a highly recommendable hotel. Only two minor points: bathroom items were not replaced and we had to ask the front desk twice to provide us toilet paper, soap, etc,, and we left, there was not a specific and secure place to leave our luggage. We left it at the lounge, following instructions of the front desk officer, and everything was fine at the end, but I am sure guests would prefer to leave it in a closed space and get a receit for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !!”
Reviews.Author: JamieLin21
Reviews.Content: A great pleace to stay. Near the Venice central and you can easily go to anywhere from the hotel. Would recommend people to stay here for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yellow1414
Reviews.Content: I booked at this hotel for 2 nights with 4 companions, and we flew out for the first day of the Venice Carnival on 26.2.11. The Hotel, once you found it and fought your way throuth the much expected crowds at that time of the year, is approx 5 mins from St Marc's square, and is right in the hub off the shops and nightlife! It was a clean and comfortable hotel, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. One of the best parts of the hotel, was the fact that most of the rooms have a private door that can only be accessed by the occupants on the respective floors. From the layout of the hotel, most rooms were situated off small corridors, which had 2 rooms per corridor. It meant that the noise level, not that we heard anything can be kept to a minimum, from people passing up and down the stairwell. Breakfast was served in the reception area. There was a vast choice for this B&B hotel, and the quality was just fine!! There was a good selection of ham and salami. There was brie and emmential (spelt wrong I'm sure!). As well as plain and sweet crossants, cakes, fresh fruit, cereals, and hot and cold drinks. You can certaintly stuff your face and still be full by lunch time (depending on your appetite of course!). Harry's Bar and the Hotel Danielle are not far away, and other places of interest like the Doge's Palace. I would certainly recommend this to anyone who want a nice hotel to go to, and are not fussed about having an all singing and dancing hotel, with lots and lots of faciliaties!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, 1 minute walk to St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: aklaw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great trip to Europe and one of our stays was at this lovely hotel. Great room, we stayed in the "triple" very spacious and had 2 bathrooms we could utilize, this was a plus we weren't aware of ahead of time. Excellent location and within 1 minutes walk to St. Mark's. Also, the breakfast was outstanding each morning and the staff superb with directions, recommendations on where to eat, and arranging water taxi for 7:00 a.m. flight home. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KaterynaZhylova
Reviews.Content: Great location of the hotel in the middle of San Marco and Rielto bridge. very good sleeping, very warm. everyday cleaning, english-italian speaking staff, vewry friendly and all the time on the place. i would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: joesob
Reviews.Content: located a few minutes north of st marks square, and less than 10 minutes walk to rialto, i chose this hotel for the price and location. i am very happy with what i got. i had a street-side room, and while noisy in the early evenings, it was silent throughout the night, until the morning garbage boat arrives. like other travellers mentioned, to me that added to the charm! the bed was comfy, too. the staff were very nice, the hotel was very clean, and the buffet breakfast was plenty-enough to start my day. my room was small. quite small. and the bathroom was tiny. very tiny. i am a new yorker, and even for me this was too small. but, it was a great choice, and i would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, highly convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Gioaro65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located right behind Piazza San Marco and only a few minutes walk from Rialto.The rooms are clean and well appointed, although not very large. Some overlook a canal. The staff was polite and professional. We found the TV set in our room was not properly tuned, we just reported to the concierge and left for the day, in the evening it had been re-tuned and the concierge came to our rooom to check if it was properly working. Breakfast is continental plus ham and cheese. All in all, a good choice and a fair room rate for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayne077
Reviews.Content: Great location near St Marks Square. Staff were very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable. The entrance area was modern and seemed to have been recently updated. Our room overlooked a canal and some early morning noise was inevitable as the canals are the only transportation routes, added to clock chimes from the square I would suggest some earplugs are packed ! Neither of these were an issue as they added to the atmosphere of being in Venice ! I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again if we were to visit the city. Top tip...... buy a good map as soon as you get there. even if you do... You WILL get lost more than once !

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION WHEN YOU FIND IT”
Reviews.Author: davebr40rt
Reviews.Content: Clean warm freindly staff good breakfast(7-10am) fantastic location 2mins ST MARKS square.Gondolas on your door step great little hotel and good value for money.If you go too this would be the place to stay.Great little bolt hole..

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiddie24
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel, it was very nice and agreable, most enjoyable, the staff is very kind and helpful. Big rooms, comfortable. I will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Civilised!”
Reviews.Author: mamaogy
Reviews.Content: Been to venice in december 2010. The hotel is on the first floor with a very secured policy. Situated nearby the square..very convenience. The best thing was, the front officer was helpful and may I say, firm and professional! They even kindly provide us the very early morning light breakfast as we have to check out early. Highly recommended to those who value the quality!

Reviews.Title: “hard beds, good quality decor, polite service”
Reviews.Author: socalarch
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel looks extremely nice. beautiful smooth venetian plaster walls. very high ceilings. our room overlooked a canal, as I had requested. It appeared perfect. But we arrived late at night and were surprised to find 36" of water flooding the streets. Obviously this was beyond the hotel's control but it would have been nice if they could've attempted to email me to warn us when the water got so high. we had no idea this was a possibility. Beyond that the service was very polite and helpful when we had questions. Wifi: you had to pay for this, and even when paid we couldn't pick up the signal in our room (which was right next to the front desk). and also only one person could use it at a time. This could be improved. Bed: Huge! except it was just two twin beds pushed together with a crack down the center, not conducive to snuggling. Even worse was how hard the bed was. My hips hurt when sleeping on my side from the hard as rock bed. This was the worst part about the hotel. and it's the reason I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend. Everything else about the hotel was good. Breakfast: great. delicious. good croissants and nutella and assorted cheese. good hot chocolate (not the terrible thick stuff the rest of italy passes off as H.C.). one suggestion: It would be nice if the hotel had some extra boots for patrons to wear when the streets are flooded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seedy0
Reviews.Content: The location was decent, but Venice is small, and the sites were spread throughout the city, so we didn't think location was that critical. The bed seemed OK, but neither of us really got a great night's sleep. The hotel was quiet, so noise was not an issue. The breakfast was good; a decent selection of items and friendly service. Our biggest complaint was with the hotel reception service. They seemed friendly and tried to help, but were not able to. When I asked about the four museums in the San Marco square (3 minutes walking away) the person at the reception had to look up the information on the web...and got it wrong. I couldn't find the entrance and in the off season they combine all the entrances into one, which he did not tell me. When we asked them to call La Zucca for reservations there was never any answer, yet the restaurant was open and implied we 'should' have called ahead. They weren't unpleasant, but in general there were always some 'gaps' with the help we received.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGravel
Reviews.Content: Cute, clean and conveniently located near San Marco. Great breakfast. You have to pay for WiFi access.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, MAGNIFICENT LITTLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Luis_Monarca
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the Best locals to Stay in Venice. We have just came back from our weekend in Venice and we are thrilled by the bbeauty of the city and this hotel gave us everything to make our stay even more magnificent. The location is superb, and the Staff is very helpful and nice. We will stay in this Hotel again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: letexplore
Reviews.Content: We've just came back from our trip to fantastic city of Venice. We stated 4 nights. Hotel has great location, just minutes from San Marco, and vaporetto, no draging suitcases over the bridges, easy walk everywhere. Hotel is cozy, home feel, clean, staff very nice and helpful. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive place”
Reviews.Author: Artington
Reviews.Content: Very clean good sized superior room was just the ticket. Friendly and welcoming and reasonably priced by Venice standards. Location is ideal for San Marco and Rialto in a bustling back street with wine bar, cafe and restaurant. Excellent double glazing kept any noise out.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: alpacatraveller
Reviews.Content: My friends and I picked the Hotel Ca del Campo because of good reviews on travel websites and also the proximity to St. Markâ€™s Square. The only downside of our stay was that I had booked a triple room â€“ stipulating that it needed 3 single beds â€“ and was not happy with the room we were put in. I am not the fussiest of people when I go travelling (after all how much actual time do you spend in the room!), but if I request (and pay for) a triple room, I donâ€™t expect a twin with an additional camp bed squeezed in. I spoke to Reception about this â€“ they were unable to move us on the first night, but moved us into a â€œproperâ€� triple room from the second night for the rest of our stay. Rant over! Apart from this, our stay at the Ca del Campo was very good. The hotel is in a pretty quiet part of Venice, the rooms were clean, breakfast plentiful, varied and tasty, and the staff very pleasant and helpful. I would use this hotel again. As an aside we really liked the Osteria ai Specchieri in Calle Largo â€“ it was on our way back to the hotel and a friendly, lively place to have a glass (or two) of Prosecco before turning in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for post-lunch (wine + pasta = zzzzzzz) naps!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Tucksteroo
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Venice is a stupendously expensive place for accomodation (and alot of other things as well) so I think this hotel was excellent value. We stayed in room 303 which looked over the little street (and the micro-canal if you looked to the right). Both the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and well laid-out. The shower had good waterpressure, and there was never any problem with getting enough hot water. I'm a light sleeper so was very happy with the double glazing that cut out those street sounds and bells that are so charming by day, but on the annoying side at night. Breakfast was good - cheese, salami, bread, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, fruited cake, pastries, juice/coffee/tea/hot choc etc... and at a decent time (8 till 10 I think). I didn't actually see much of the staff (which I like!), but they were always available on the front desk, and were polite and helpful (and impressively multilingual!). The location was great - between Piazza San Marco and Rialto bridge, which was great for going for a siesta after every overindulgence of pasta/salad/fish/tiramisu/gelato and wine. I've already recommended this hotel to a few friends, and I'd stay there again if we go back to Venice (which is likely - had a great time!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel In A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: richard_bushnell1
Reviews.Content: What a little gem this hotel proved to be. We arrived on The Vaporetto at St Marks Square on an Autumn High Tide and the square was flooded!! We were concerned that we would have to drag our luggage for miles to get to the hotel. It was only about 10 minutes away though and, after working out what side of St Zulian Church it was, we were there. It is smart outside but the inside is a revelation with beautifully furnished rooms for a fairly modest standard of hotel. The staff had arranged for our room to be ready early and in an easily accessible location for my disabled wife. They couldn't do enough for us. It is wonderfully placed for all the tourist attractions in The St. Marco area, but far enough away to be quiet. It was very well sound-proofed and the room we had was nicely furnished and equipped. Breakfast was substantial for a continental one and served in a delightful area off reception. We will definitely return next year to try and see all that we missed in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Friendly Staff and Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: hatchLondon
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at this hotel in August for their 45th wedding anniversary a trip I booked them. They were delighted with the hotels postition in Venice and thought the breakfast was ample. Room was spacious and very clean and the staff very friendly and willing to help with my parents enquires on what to do etc..... A great place to stay in Venice was their veiw and they would throughly recommend this hotel to others. As a kind gesture as a surpise for my parents a bottle of champagne was placed in their room for their anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to explore Venice!”
Reviews.Author: RST-Glendale
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that's is a great contemporary, clean refuge with a great location, then this is it. You have to navigate through the crowds in the Piazza and through some classic, narrow walkways, but it's worth it. Ca Del Campo Hotel is located an easy luggage pull from the San Marco vaporetto stop, and that is located in a tucked away street, yet only steps away from the Piazza San Marco and all its lively day and night happenings, a great cichetti bar, variety of shops, tons of restaurants, and even an old church (San Zulian). And the breakfast buffet was much more than I expected...fresh bread rolls, deli sliced ham and salami, with fresh cheeses, yogurts, freshly brewed coffee and tea...we started out our day well, and found the hotel staff to be most helpful. The bathroom shower was a tight squeeze, the ventilation could have been better for it, and the room was compact as well. But we had a lovely view, lots of natural light, and a good bed. I was glad we choose it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean comfortable hotel in a super central location.”
Reviews.Author: theoldfolks81
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Hotel renovated to a very high standard in Venetian style. Rooms spacious clean and comfortable. Highly recommended. When next we visit Venice the Ca' del Campo Hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “FAN FLIPPIN' TASTIC”
Reviews.Author: critique007
Reviews.Content: We did not have high hopes for this hotel... HOWEVER we were pleasantly surprised when showed to our room. The room was equipped with two bathrooms, which was excellent for our family of four. We didn't feel like we were getting in each others' way, because the room provided plenty of space. However, the elevator was miniscule, but should we be surprised? It is Venice after all. Good location, breakfast was good, coffee was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “6.5 out of 10. JUST OK”
Reviews.Author: tg49ers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate our one year wedding anniversay, I would say this would be a upper end 3.5 star hotel. I had emailed the hotel directly to give them heads up as I really wanted this stay to be a special one. Out of the two weeks we were in Europe, I had planned Venice as the place to celebrate our offical 'one year'. They had emailed me and said i was booked in a superior canal facing room, like they were doing my a favour, but that is exactly what i was paying for! Location - As many have pointed out, it is abit of a nightmare trying to find this hotel as you have to go down a few of side narrow streets to get there. It is not far from all the action St Marc Square and all the shops and restaurants. Rooms - After we checked in, we went to our 'superior canal facing' room, which was on a lower floor, we thought the decorating of the rooms was unique compared to the other hotels we stayed at, with the 18th century style decorating. The canal view they gave was was very poor, if you looked down you could see the canal but I would not go so far to say it was romantic in any way shape or form. Another building was overlooking ours, with ratty clothes hanging down the side, so keeping the blinds open was not an option. The hotel's "ground rules" listed on the elevator seemed abit demanding, no outside food or drinks in the hotel room other than eating from their mini bar? No ironing in the rooms? The air conditioning was fairly loud which i found abit annoying. There also was a small 17" LCD computer monitor that was also our television, one english channel, but very hard to watch. Staff and Service - We found the staff pleasant enough but I would not go as far to say they were extremely friendly or helpful at all, seemed more concerned about watching the security cameras or reading the paper. They knew we were there for our one year anniversary, and they had made no effort what so ever to even say "congratulations" We woke up abit late for breakfast one morning, so we arrived at 10:15, and breakfast ended at 10am. the food was still out and a couple of people were still eating, so we just grabbed a plate and started to eat - well, the recpetionist came up to us and not even politely she scolded us for being late - we were ok with that as we knew we were. A few minutes later the cleaning staff for the eating area seemed visibly upset with us and she said something to another worker - we were then scolded on a second time. I thought this was abit overboard, we are not children, we got the point, and to scold paying clients the way they did was not right either. In the service industry you have to be nice about things like this, that is my opinion. And speaking of the food, breakfast wasn't anything special, a small selection of food, the only real good thing about it was the coffee. One last thing about the service, we had asked for a late checkout for 2pm, as our flight was not leaving until 5, they told us they were very busy and had to get the room ready. Which we understood. no problem. we left our luggage in the lobby and walked around. We came back to the hotel at 2:30 and i sat down to rest. Then i noticed the maid just going in the room to start cleaning it, I was not too impressed with seeing that. Felt abit dishonest to me, they could have just told us they don't give late check outs. Overall, I was happy enough with our stay, I was hoping it was going to a memorable one year anniversary but it didn't quite live up to what I was expecting. If you can get a good price for this hotel, I would say stay there, but if i were to go back again, I would DEFINITELY find another hotel as there are likely well over a hundred hotels in or around the Square, as we soon found out during our touring around the area.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmaryclare
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for us, just 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square, and as we hadn't been to Venice for over 20 years it was easy to get to and orientate ourselves from. The hotel was immaculately clean, and we rented a "family room" which is always a bit of a gamble with two tall teenagers in tow. They gave us a fantastic 2-roomed suite on the top floor, with 2 bathrooms. (I would recommend you request it) It was spacious and well-furnished, and we will definitely return to this great hotel. The breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff were very helpful. I saw another comment about how to find this hotel which was really useful. Walk under the clock in the main square, go straight on, and then turn right at the Ferrari shop, walk around the Church, keeping right, and then turn left, and the little street is just on your right (with a great little bar/cafe on the corner). And, the air-conditioning worked!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for understanding the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: thestourbridgelion
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a short distance from St. Marks square. Many nearby facilities and the local canal runs a few steps from the front door. Good air conditioning in the rooms. Staff were helpful and multilingual. A local strike by the the Vaparetto(water bus) was advised to us by the staff so we could tailor our movements around the reduced transport. Did not appear to be any "hidden extra" charges in the rates. Accomodation was very clean and rooms were made up by early afternoon ready to return to. The poor exchange rate with the Â£ made the hotel a little expensive but this is obviously not the fault of the hotel.. All in all a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful,clean, safe hotel in a quiet and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sad7288
Reviews.Content: Half way between San Marco and Rialto, the hotel was so quiet we felt we had it to ourselves. We had a suite next to the front desk, which initially concerned me, but it was very quiet. Perfect for a family with older children, as they had their own room with sink, while we had a master with a bathroom. A/C is appreciated for the quiet and to beat the humidity, although the windows do open. First floor has 20' ceilings and chandeliers in the rooms. Continental breakfast was good, with coffee fresh brewed for each guest. If you're concerned about safety, this is the place, as the door is on a buzzer at all times, and the desk is staffed 24 hours. Staff is quietly attentive, and speaks English. Convenient cafe and newstand just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: TedJulia
Reviews.Content: Our second time in Venice, we decided to stay a bit more central and the location of the hotel is excellent, being a very short walk from St Mark's square. Although so close to the square it is remarkably quiet, the staff are very courteous and the service was excellent. The hotel is typical in style to most in the area, and it took a while to find, but after noting a few landmarks we had no trouble and although the streets can be confusing at first, you soon become familiar with your surroundings. Venice is notorious for being expensive, but we found plenty of nearby restaurants that were reasonably priced with excellent food. Tea and coffee facilities would have been handy in the rooms, though. Don't miss the island of Burano and the Lido - well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming, helpful and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Iggy215
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel, close to all the biggest attractions but still set in a relatively quiet and peaceful area. The staff needs to buzz you in to the building so we felt very secure. We had the family room on the first floor and were pleased with it. There were two bedrooms, each with two twin beds, very high ceilings with chandaliers, windows opening to the courtyard in front of the hotel and the small canal on the side of the hotel. The first night I made the mistake of leaving the windows open and found that the boat traffic (deliveries and trash boats) start very early and don't mind making some noise. One morning I just stuck my head out the window and watched the boat traffic for about an hour (I guess I am easily amused). It is amazing how they maneuver the boats, some of which are fairly large, in the narrow canals, with lots of boat traffic, mixed in with a good number of gondolas. We took a gondola ride from right next to the hotel through the smaller canals, we paid $80 Euro for a trip of about 35 minutes. That is the economy tour and they tried to get us to go for the $100 Euro option. I would do it again even though it was expensive. Get your Vaporetto passes ahead of time for a discount on a site called Venice connected. That site also has a virtual interactive walking tour in which I walked from San Marcos to the hotel and it made it easy to find when I actually arrived. Its easy to get lost in Venice, which is OK unless you are carting luggage with you, then it wouldn't be fun. Here are the easiest directions to the hotel: Get off the Vaporetto near San Marcos Basilica, walk through the Piazza San Marcos (facing the front of the Basilica) and go to the left of the Basilica. Pass a small raised fountain area guarded by two stone lions and you will see the Hotel Concordia on your left. There is a small road or alley that actually splits through the Hotel Concordia, take that straight for about 100 yards, it is extremely narrow, single file in each direction, pass the hotel Monte Carlo, when you get to San Zulian church on your left, turn right onto Campo De La Guerra and the hotel is on your right just before you get to the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in a clean beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mijoOntario
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ca' del Campo took excellent care of us. Our room was easily changed to two twins when we asked, the desk staff were multilingual and professional, and everything was gleaming, clean, and beautifully decorated. We enjoyed our breakfast in the lovely dining area. We were a five-minute walk from the dock at the Piazza San Marco. Thank-you for a reasonably-priced, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in central location”
Reviews.Author: roselllii
Reviews.Content: Ca' del Campo is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. The room was much bigger than I imagined, was quite comfortable, and gorgeous! Great canal views. Also, the shower was fantastic!!! Heating unit was adjustable, and there was a heated drying rack/towel warmer in the bathroom, both of which were of great use during our cold, snowy stay. Very easy to find, just straight down Calle Specchiere, to the right of the clock tower off to the right side of San Marco Piazza, and then a right turn onto Campo Del Guerra. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and even provided me with coffee on the morning of my 3am departure! Breakfast was, I thought, very good--especially the coffee!! If you'd like to use the internet, it's only E15 for 24h of time, so definitely worth it. Close to Rialto, vaporetto stops, and easy walking distance from the delicious restaurants that can be found in the San Polo sestiere. Would HAPPILY stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: SteveAustin64
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in March with family - 2 adults - 2 teens. Rooms were clean. Staff was very helpful. The location is great to access Rialto Bridge and San Marco square. Lots of little things nearby too for water, wine, snacks, etc. This was a very positive experience for us. I highly recommend it. The walk from San Marco square is not very far with luggage - and no bridges to cross. If you want to leave quicker - 2 bridges to Rialto for the ferry pick up and it is a quick ride to the Train Station. And there was even a Gondola ride to get ride outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Paulineone
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Dec 2009 for 3 nights and could not fault it. Location was so good for walking to all major tourist sites, staff were very helpful, rooms well serviced. Breakfast was fairly average but adequate. Would have no hesitation in staying there again. One thing - there is no Venice Christmas Market this year - as this was the main purpose of our trip it was disappointing, but the shops were very Christmassy and all was not lost!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in July 2008. Our first room was very hot, humid and stuffy and it did not have any AC. They provided us w/ a portable unit but this was bulky, noisy and made no difference. They moved us to a superior room on the top floor after some whining and it was far more temperate and had a nice view of a canal. I am generally not one to complain and can put up w/ a lot but the heat in the first room was unbearable. The location is great, only 2 mins from St Mark's square. The hotel, like many in Venice I'm sure, is adapted from private residences and access to rooms weave in, around, up and down which was quaint. The kids enjoyed this although dragging our bags around was a challenge. In general the service was good and since they did move us to a better room, I shouldn't complain. We only had breakfast at the hotel and it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Sussex
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, perfect location and very easy to find. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and welcoming. Room was so clean and very spacious. The only downside was the breakfast wasn't great but better than nothing I suppose. I also thought it was a little expensive but then that is Venice for you. Was very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, spacious and comfortable rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Tykerb
Reviews.Content: A short skip from San Marco, but reassuringly quiet and comfortable, this place is perfect for a brief stay in Venice. Our room was surprisingly spacious, and modern, and we felt, we got good value for a stay in Venice. The staff were courteous, but not overly helpful with guiding us towards decent restaurants, or bars; so have your plans made out before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GillyMac99
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Ca' del Campo recently. It is, as their website decribes, just 100 steps from St Mark's Square. The location was perfect - convenenient to pop back to the hotel from anywhere to shower and change. The room was quite small but beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and well-maintained and the staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the continental breakfasts and would be very happy to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: blink09
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, amazing breakfasts and great service! You can't go wrong staying here. We rented 2 adjoining rooms overlooking the canals and LOVED it! Clean, marble floors, high ceilings and great location. Walk everywhere...its so central! Thank you for a great stay. We'll stay there again. :-) p.s. take the tour of the Jewish quarter...fascinating history!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gonetothedogz8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for the steeply priced Venice. It's a two minute walk to Piazza San Marco and on a fairly small side street, making it convenient and very quiet. There's a nice little wine bar across the way for a cafe or glass of wine, with good paninis. The room was very small but nice enough-- looked a little worn and could use some updating. Overall, I'd recommend this for a reasonably priced place just off San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location and value, would stay again !!!!”
Reviews.Author: DARTH123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a top end 3 star without a doubt. Its extremely clean, well airconditioned and newly refurbished. I was more than happy with the room which was large with a large sized bathroom and large bed. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. When we went to the lobby to use our mobile to book two excursions, the lady at reception made the calls for us, using her phone and we were able to pay her there and she issued us the tickets, saving us any fuss! The breakfast is good, with a selection of meats, bread, cheeses, yogurts, Croissant with fruit inside, cereal, fruit, tea and coffee. There was more than enough with the items being replinsihed constantly by the staff. On our last night we found a brilliant restaurant litteraly 10 seconds from the hotel. Its called Osteria Nr 1 and does brilliant food in a pretty courtyard location. We found a lot of the restaurants added 12 - 20 % service charge and were not good quality. Osteria Nr 1 does not add any service charges and had no hidden costs. It isn't a toursit only place as we were surrounded by Italians both local and on holiday. It is a guaranteed good meal and the wine started at 12 Euros a bottle instead of at least 20 in all other restaurants. Use this hotel and you wont be let down !!!

Reviews.Title: “Central to San Marco and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: AussiesInEurope
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located to see the sights of Venice. San Marco square is within 3 minutes walk of the front door. There is so much to see and do in Venice and this hotel puts you right in the heart of where you need to be. The concierge was very helpful except for the internet service that you were meant to be able to access from your room but really had to be done in the reception area because the router didn't work on floor 3! The breakfast was your typical continental breakfast consisting of pastries, ham, cheese and jams. The rooms were clean and comfortable with a reasonable sized bathroom compared to other european hotels and we barely heard a noise during the night. Restaurants are all around the hotel but there is an excellent one straight across the road from the front door which is called Laguna Blu.

Reviews.Title: “Good but probably not best place”
Reviews.Author: Kikoz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated not far from San Marco at historical building. - There is no free internet, and cost is 5euro /1hour! Looks like overpriced. We had not WiFi on 3 flour because WiFi routers did not work right at all hotel except at reception, so we used our laptop at public area near reception. - there is a plate at elevator with note "it is prohibited to eat at room. Prohibited to keep meal and refreshments at fridge at room." I rejected these rules and kept cheese, fruits and cola in fridge and ate it :) - no coffeemakers or teapot at room. (looks like all hotels in Italy hasn't it) - hotel has entry door which always locked. You should ring a bell and wait till receptionist open it, sometimes 3 second sometimes 1-2 minutes. Not very good. Probably because reception desk is on 1st flour near entry. + we got free very good map of Venice. + near from San Marco + breakfasts were with cheese and ham (not all 3* hotels in Italy has ham on breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TriniAussie
Reviews.Content: At the end of January 2009, my wife and I embarked on a European tour, where we visited London, Athens, Rome, Venice, Vienna, Paris, Amsterdam, Oslo, and then we popped back to London. We chose all of our hotels based on reviews that we read on this website, so it is our duty to come online and at least write a short review. Tripadvisor was a Godsend, and we swear by it now. What a quirky city! We had never been to Venice before, and were absolutely blown away by the concept of a city on water. Nothing we read beforehand could have prepared us for Venice. However, this is a hotel review, so I shall stick to just that. ï�Š We came via train from Rome, so we arrived at the train station. Be prepared to travel around Venice either by boat or foot. We took the water bus to the nearest station as per the hotel website and the tourist person at the train station. However, be prepared for at least a fifteen minute walk from the water bus stop to the hotel. On top of that, be prepared to lug your luggage through narrow streets (and of course, up and down step bridges every fifty metres or so!). The taxis that would have dropped us at the hotel were extremely expensive, and after all, itâ€™s still a boat taxi, so a fair amount of lugging still needs to be done. Please note that you will encounter this transportation problem regardless of which hotel you choose, due to the nature of the city. (You will understand once you get there.) The hotel is centrally located, but then again, so are all hotels in Venice. Expect to be able to walk to any of the landmarks in Venice: two minutes to St. Markâ€™s Square and twenty five minutes to the church where they filmed Indiana Jones in the 80â€™s. Our room was massive in terms of square footage. However, one could see that the furnishings were dated. Clean, but old. The bathroom was quite new though, and the toiletries were acceptable. The television was comical: it was probably an eleven inch telly. Seriously, it was a very very small telly, and given the size of the room, donâ€™t expect to be able to read any subtitles whilst lying in bed. The service was good, in that everyone was so helpful, but the breakfast was very basic. Very few hot items if I recall. Considering the price, you will get excellent value for money: good service, a fairly comfortable room, and central location. If you want luxury, then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreea_erika
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice with my friends and we had the pleasant surprise to find this hotel so beautiful and welcoming. The breakast was delicious, the room was very nice decorated and quite large and the staff extremely friendly, always smiling and helping us. It was very close to san Marco Square and easy to get to any part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just off San Marco, with style!”
Reviews.Author: Senena
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that is up-market, has great service, is centrally located, and has space to move, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: BiscuitSlough
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ca Del Campo on 21 Oct for 2 nights. What a fantastic location. It certainly helped finding the hotel by using a previous reviewer's directions which were very helpful. As you arrive at St Marks Square, take the road under the clock, turn right and you arrive at San Zulian Church (a landmark to look out for is the Ferrari shop. If you get to this you are literally round the corner). The hotel is at the back of the church in Campo della Guerra. The staff were very friendly and breakfast was typical european fare, croissants, ham, cheese, panettone cake, cappuccino etc. October is a fantastic month to visit Venice as you miss the hoards of people that probably visit in the Summer. We had great weather, about 20degrees both days we were there. Took a gondola ride from right outside the hotel on our first morning and the gondolier said as we were the first ride of the day, he would let us pay 80 euros instead of the usual 100 euros. Don't know if this was true but looking at websites and prices before our trip, it certainly seemed to be slightly cheaper than usual, so may be worth taking a morning ride rather than early evening, which seems to be the most popular time for couples. Excellent restaurants all around the hotel area, lots of shops and cafes for the obligatory espresso and to watch the world go by. As it was quite warm, we ate al fresco both nights we were there. Overall, a fantastic 2 days in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, strangely difficult to find!”
Reviews.Author: Cnoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed to celebrate our first anniversay. Trying to find the hotel was a bit of a nightmare, with none of the locals really either helpful or interested in being helpful. That said our taxi driver was great (water taxi is a great way to enter the city - and totally worth it despite the cost). Having found the hotel, our room was initially impressive, though the view was not so great. It was a pretty manky alleyway - not so romantic. Though the furniture was rococo in style, the bathroom tidy and impressive, the a/c was seriously loud. The hotel does have a thing about ironing in your room and I had to go to the fourth floor to iron my shirt with the hotel iron. The stafff were not wholely friendly initially, but a little work goes a long way. After a day two of my friendliness and halting Italian, they were quite helpful. The breakfast is pretty poor limited , and unimaginative. However the maid seems to be very very willing to drown you in coffee. Venitians are often described as cold fish, and this hotel is quite Venitian. The hotel is in a great location, once you get your bearings, I would stay there again, after all in Venice you wont be spending too much of your time in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: AndreaPLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room at this hotel as we needed a babysitter for the Saturday night of our 2 day stay. The hotel quoted EURO 150 for the evening - 5 hours on an average nothing special weekend in the off season. Incredible. With no other choice, we had to take their one babysitter and really hated paying 30 EURO an hour for someone to sit with two sleeping children..... And then the hotel charged us EURO 120 for a late check out on a Sunday afternoon - as they thought they might be able to book the room that day and needed to have it cleaned and ready. We found this incredibly rude and disappointing, but again just paid up as we really had no other choice (we were flying at 21.40 and had a 2 and 5 year old with us). This is not great customer service. The hotel is naff, dated, pokey and still has those rubbish "hairdryers" in the bathrooms which are just a tube weakly blowing hot air at you if you can get the angle right. Honestly.... didn't those go out in the 1970s ? The breakfast was weak too - hardly any choice and what there was ran out by the end anyway... Don't do it - there are SO many hotels in Venice, you will find a better one. We would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Will not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Aarvi
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the evening, and with a promise for a family room, we were given Attic place on the 4th - for 200 Euros!!! A/C did not work at all, and when we complanied a small fan was given. On a very hot day, a fan for a family of 4. Next morning when we complanied again, the receiptionist was not friendly taking in the complaint. Very poor breakfast - almost limited to very few stuff - even at 8 in the morning. We left the hotel after breakfast, and went in search for another hotel. Got one , came back and Checked out. The real trouble started here. Later I realized that I had left my Cell phone - iPhone in the hotel itself. Came back, and there was another person at the reception desk. He came with us to the room - searched with us for it every where. Came back to the desk to see if any lost & found item was filled in. Nothing. He told me to leave a complanit with him, and that he will check with his collegue who was there earlier about it. Next morning, I went back to the hotel and found no news about finding the phone in the room. There was a temp staff at the reception - after I cried and requested to her to find my phone from the maids or the other receptionist ( the person who was there when we checked out), she took my number and promised to do so. She did call me and told me that they found my iPhone, and that her collegue found it, but forgot!! to file in the lost & found. She said her collegue who found it would mail it to me, if I give them my credit card details. I sent it via email, and it was mailed to me - 60 Euros for fed-Ex. When the phone arrived, I was shocked to find that it was tampered, and that the person at the reception (don't want to give the name), has played with it, to make it his own!!! and that was the reason he did not file it in lost & found! I was lucky to get my phone back at least I guess. But would not go back to this hotel, and would never recommend it for any one!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique hotel, 3 minute walk to San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: RobertKaren
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for my partner and 3 adult kids in July after reading good reviews on TA. Rooms and bathrooms were decent size for Venice. Ideally located about 3 minute walk from San Marco Square and 5 minutes from the Rialto area , the hotel is very nicely laid out and very clean. We paid Euro 150 for the double and Euro 200 for the triple. Reception was excellent, friendly and very helpful with bookings. Breakfast (included) was the usual European fare and very nice. Being in the middle of Venice there are plenty of restaurants and of course the shopping. Definitely to be recommended and we will be staying there again when we go back in September

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: velinas
Reviews.Content: This place is like a boutique hotel. There is no bar here, the breakfast in the morning is typical European. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very accommodating. If you are going to Venice this is the place to stay. I have been to Venice 3 times and if I ever went back I would stay here. The price is moderate and you get everything that a expensive place has to offer, except a more personal service because of the size. If you go out of hotel and take a right over the bridge and then your first left about 1/2 block down is a grocer and you can pick up some good inexpensive wine and enjoy a glass in the sitting area of the hotel which are party did every night. There were 7 of us with 4 rooms and not one person had a complaint. You can catch the water taxi right out the door by the bridge. There are several restaurants around hotel 2 right across the street (pizzeria), which are great. San Marks Square is a 2 minute walk (if that) and the Rialto Bridge is 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Brit_USA_Traveler
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the rail station, we took the water bus to St. Marks. We had a little difficulty actually finding the hotel the first time, because it has no big sign, but once we did we went into an old building that was TOTALLY modernized and quite lovely. Our room was a triple and it was actually a big bathroom, a room with a single bed connected to a room with a double. We had a lot of space. Decorations were good and the room and bathroom very clean. The breakfast in the morning was good - cereals, juice, bread, cheese etc. The hotel is VERY close to both St. Marks and the Rialto, but it is on a quiet street, right by a gondola stop. I really liked the position as it was easy to go back for a nap and then out to a restaurant in the evening. Venice was cool while we were there, but the room was lovely and warm. Nice hotel and having two rooms for a triple was great.

Reviews.Title: “Close to St Mark's Square!”
Reviews.Author: caz126
Reviews.Content: What I love about this hotel is that it is situated in a fabulous location. To get to the hotel itself, you have to wind down little street alleys - which you discover along the way and it adds to the holiday atmosphere. Being so close to St Mark's Square was a bonus given that the Campanile, Orological Clock Tower, Correr Museum, Doges Palace and the Basilica are all situated around the square. Also, a nice quick stroll down to nearby Rialto Bridge for some food was convenient. Overall, a neat little find in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: jayemtee
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I contacted the hotel to book direct. They do not have a secure booking area and I had to telephone to give them credit card details but as they had a good command of English this wasn't a problem. We caught the Alilaguna vaporetto for 12 Euros pp from the airport which is a wonderful way to start any visit to Venice. A water taxi would cost you about 7 times more. I recommend you do some research of where the hotel is situated before you go as it makes walking through the streets of Venice with a suitcase a little easier. It is possible to reach the hotel from St. Marks Square vaporetto stops without having to go over any bridges. The hotel is comfortable and security is good as there is someone on reception 24 hours and the only way in is via an intercom entrance. We paid 1000Euros for a 4 night stay in a 'superior' double room including breakfast which was more than adequate. Our room overlooked the small canal at the side of the hotel and although not an attractive view it was nice to see and hear the boats and gondolas going past. There were one or two noisy early mornings whilst the Venetians went about their work delivering goods or collecting rubbish but it added to the atmosphere. The hotel is in an excellent position for walking around Venice and for getting to the Basilica and Doges Palace early. There are many good restaurants nearby and I would recommend you walk away from St. Marks Square for good value. A personal favourite was Restaurant Al Peoceto Risorto in the Rialto and by the mercato del pesce (fish market). When visiting the Basilica take the stairway to the right just as you go in the entrance. It costs 3 Euros to go in but well worth it as it includes going on to the balcony with a view over St. Marks Square and gives you a better view of the mosaics on the ceiling. All in all a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: janesk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, with about a five minute walk from the main square. The only thing I didnt like was that the room was the smallest of all the rooms we stayed in during our trip through Italy. The shower was really small, very uncomfortable. But it is venice, so I guess that's how it is as there isnt much space unless you go to the really high end hotels. Breakfast was included and it was good and the staff was very nice. I would stay there again - if I get a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: CliveNoble
Reviews.Content: I don't like booking anything unknown through the Internet, but this time we struck gold. Amazing location, everywhere is walkable from '511' The room (303) was good and quiet when the window was closed, (3rd floor overlooking the front) Airconditioning very good. Breakfast was very adequate and kept us going 'till our evening meal. Complimentary coffee, cold drinks and biscuits available in the reception area all day (and probably night) I know it is only a hotel for sleeping in, but from a professional point of view, I was amazed at the quality of furniture, electrics, plumbing, even the door hinges were expensive!!! The bed was as comfy as our own at home. There was only one problem...... I left the directions at home of how to get there by foot and it took a long time asking many shopkeepers and restauranters.... "Where is 511" The wait was worthwhile and when we return to Venice, we will be back to this charming little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotless, can find no fault”
Reviews.Author: rob68
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Venice, having booked the hotel with no knowledge other than other reviews, price and location as detailed on an internet site. The location was fantastic (2 mins from St Mark's Sqaure, 5 mins from the Realto bridge), the room was spotless and a very good size, the air conditioning worked very well and breakfasts were filling and taken in a lovely setting. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful and assisted with organising tours and taxi's. The hotel has a 'homely' feel (no huge 'Hotel' sign over the door!) rather than a large (impersonal/corporate) hotel and we were made to feel very welcome. We simply couldn't find any fault at all and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: chillb
Reviews.Content: would agree with the other reviews, we had a lovely stay. only negative thing I can say is that I was very suprised that the bed in the bedroom is actually a sofa bed, and to me when you book a room with a bed you are not really asking for a room with a sofa (which was never used as such) that is open to a bed. It was comfortable but it was our wedding anniversary and took a bit of the romance out of it all. the place was spotless, and the staff very pleasant. and venice was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bellfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good points and some weaknesses. It is within 5 minutes walk of St Marks Sq and well placed for other attractions. We were able to pop back to have a rest in the middle of the day. Our room (108), which opened directly into the reception area, was clean, quite spacious although with no easy chair, and had a well appointed shower room. The twin beds were comfortable with good mattresses. Overhead, attached to the high ceiling, was an enormous chandelier in the style of those in the Doges Palace. The window looked out on the adjacent canal and was extremely quiet at night. In fact the hotel as a whole had a subdued ecclesiastical air about it. The reception is on the first floor and the entrance to the hotel is quite anonymous. You have to press a buzzer to be let in by remote control from reception. There is a lift, but there are a few steps to surmount before you get to it. Once inside there is one public area which serves as reception, lounge and breakfast room.
