Tea and coffee making facilities are provided here (but not in the room) in the shape of a flask of hot water and some sachets, but when we tried the arrangement the water had cooled too much. The canal seemed to be a source of mosquitoes and, even in March, we were quite badly bitten. (We caught one culprit which was too heavy with our blood to escape.) Thereafter we slept with the window shut, but the air conditioning, which heated the room very effectively when needed, struggled to keep the room cool overnight. The breakfast was very limited in scope with croissants which looked like normal croissants but which were filled with a rather sickly jam, and tepid coffee. The main features of this hotel are OK, especially if you want somewhere central yet quiet, but it is not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: robster38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from a super three days at this hotel. When we go back to Venice we will stay here again and recommend it highly. The hotel was distant enough from St Marks Square to be quiet and close enough the hub of the citie's canals and all that fantastic coffee, pizza and pastry. The staff were very amicable and tolerant of my command (few words) of Italian that I strung together. The rooms were kept spotless for us and an extra blanket and pillows were available very quickly when requested. Our room (number 108) had a shower and no bath, the bed was huge and the centrepiece of the room was a beautiful chandelier. We had a view overlooking the canal but it was not noisy. The internet access was not working when we stayed but this was a minute worry for us. The breakfast set up was neat, friendly and timely and we paid around â‚¬490 for a three night stay in a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value/money”
Reviews.Author: Ian007
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The hotel offers exelent value for money. We paid A little more than 100Euro/night in early march (low season). For that you get a perfect location, just a few steps from Piazza San Marco! Very nice hotel in general, not a luxury hotel though, but for sure better than the average 3* in Venice. Spotless rooms, modern bathroom (not usual in venice) and friendly and helpfull staff. Not outstanding but personalized service. Go for it :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in lovely Venice”
Reviews.Author: Smale
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights - monday to thursday - at this hotel late January/early February 2007. The hotel is very centrally located for the sights and getting around Venice. We had a room by the reception which had a nice view. The staff were very helpful and polite. Their recommendations the hotel made for restaurants and places to visit were very helpful. Breakfast was very nice and a good start to the day! Hotel is very comfortable and clean. If we were going to Venice again we would stay there again or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location if you want to be near the action”
Reviews.Author: fsy
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and booked 2 adjoining rooms ("family room") with 1 bath on first floor facing the canal. Location of hotel is most convenient to SanMarco and shops. Hotel not easy to find the first time -- but that is the hallmark of Venice. [Take alley next to America cafe to Cartier store. Bear right and go around little church to small square. Hotel at end of square, on RHS]. It helps to have seen the picture of hotel front entrance on website as there is no large signage outside front door. It is amazing how quiet the little square is just around the corner from all the shops. Rooms are large and airy with good but old-fashioned furnishings. Breakfast is adequate but not exciting though the staff is very courteous. If you want to book a watertaxi to go to airport, you would do well to book directly with operator rather than through the hotel -- they add on a wobbing 50% "service charge" (90 euro instead of 60 if you book directly). They will pick you up at canal right next to hotel -- if not at low tide -- which is very convenient. Restaurants in Venice are expensive and food is not good. We had a bad experience at Trattoria a la Bricola around the corner from hotel -- the waiter was dishonest as well as rude. He advised us to change our order to another fish which he said was fresher and about the same price as our original order but it turned out to be 3 times as much when the bill came -- that 1 course came to 50 euro and was burned!! He also put another item on our bill which we never got. When confronted, he became abusive! Stay away!! Overall, hotel is convenient, comfortable, clean, reasonable, but no-frills.

Reviews.Title: “As expected, very good but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel confirmed we were not confirmed less than 24 hours before our arrival in Venice. We were lucky to find a double available at the del Campo, and found the front office staff prompt and responsive to our travelling e mails. The hotel and rooms were as described: clean, secure, well appointed baths, english spoken by the staff, spartan but adequate breakfast in a pleasant straightforward grand hall. Best location around, less than 10 minute walk with three bags from San Marco vaporetto stop. Overlooks an uninteresting canal that can be busy at night (garbage gondolas). for the money and last minute, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lewes
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this lovely hotel and had a very comfortable, good size room facing the street with a side view of a canal & bridge. I would imagine the rooms overlooking the canal may be quite noisy, although the double glazing does well in cutting out a lot of the noise. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and credit must be given to the cleaners who are totally unobtrusive. The rooms have a daily change of linen and towels and are left immaculate on your return, which is a delight after spending a busy day sight-seeing. If there is any criticism to be made (and this is only a minor detail), it would be with the breakfasts. Although perfectly adequate and acceptable, it would be nice to have a little variety day to day, as every morning was the same. Perhaps a different choice of juice, fresh fruit, pastries etc. It's probably fine if you're staying for 2 or 3 nights, but any longer and it all gets a bit samey! The location of the hotel couldn't really be better. It's a very easy 2-3 minute walk to St Marks Square and 5 minutes to the Rialto (once you know the way!). It is so easy to get lost in this city, but that's all part of the fun of it, and you so often come across lovely little piazzas quite by mistake. Also, it feels very safe walking through the narrow streets, even late at night, we never felt uncomfortable with it. Restaurants can be very expensive and vary in quality. One recommendation we would make though is the Trattatoria alla Scala, which is just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, where we found the food to be excellent and not too overpriced! It was always busy (surely a good sign), so you would do well to book.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: VGiyer
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Great Location!'!! Of course we got the best room, we got the room with 2 balconies... and from the balcony you could see the boats, gondolas, bridges, all the VENETIAN surroundings.. The people were very friendly..and very helpful. We were travelling with a 2 year old and hence needed a lot of help and they were more than willing to do so. The breakfast was very good. And we stayed in 2 other hotels in Italy, ( in Florence and Rome!) and I am going to vote this the BEST!..

Reviews.Title: “Great place/location”
Reviews.Author: JubileeBlue
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in good location. Easy walk to St. Marks and the other way to Rialto Bridge. We stayed in the Green Room and slept very well, this is a very quiet location. The breakfast was more than adequate and the staff helpful. They know Venice very well, one guy was born there. There are several nice restaurants and wine bars nearby. We had an easy walk from the St. Marks Vaporetti stop to the hotel. The streets behind St. Marks are narrow but we didn't have to cross any bridges. If walking through the Venice streets to get there bothers you then don't go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Ca'del Campo Sept 2006”
Reviews.Author: eza
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean. excellent location, great breakfast and pleasant staff. Nothing else you could ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: blumoon76
Reviews.Content: I was very excited for this hotel but it was not what I had expected. First be prepared it is hell getting through those Venice streets and bridges with suitcases and the crowds of tourists. From the train station we took a boat to the Rialto line and made our way to the hotel. We got there at 2:30pm during the middle of the heat wave and the streets were packed. It is not the easiest place to find and a bit overwhelming when you get off the boat! When were arrived we were literally dripping wet! We checked in and the desk staff was helpful with info. about getting a water cab for an early flight (90 Euros). Our room was very, very small facing the front. The bed was practically on the ground and my husband and I were tripping over each other trying to get around. The bathroom was even smaller. The shower looked like a space capsule, it was almost impossible to shave my leg. The worse thing was the air conditioning. It only spit small amounts of cool air out, we laided on the bed trying to cool off but continued sweating. We did not want to sound like spoiled Americans so we tried to deal with it the best we could figuring it is such a small room it has got to cool off soon. At night it got so hot my husband laid on the floor under the a/c to get some relief and some sleep. I couldn't take it anymore so called the front desk for a fan. The could not find one, so the only suggestion he could give me was to open the window, however there is a wine bar underneath our window with lots of noisy people. We were not offered a new room or an apology. I just asked if he would look for a fan for the next night but never recieved one. Now that I go back and read other reviews maybe I should have complained more or tried to reserve that red room!!! The hotel is in a great location, five minutes from St. Mark's but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and old but the location will win your heart.”
Reviews.Author: PishPosh
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Venice via vaporetto at St. Marks, we tried to look for the hotel but got lost in a major fashion and actually overshot the hotel big time. We had to ask a Gondolier for directions and thank god for his accurate tips. Directions to the hotel : Go behind St Marks square and turn right, you will see a McDonalds, take a left turn immediately after you see the McDs. On the corener will be a shoe shop. Walk straight until you see a T junction and turn right. The hotel is on the right side towards the canal. Upon arriving the hotel, you will be greeted by a nice, small and clean stairway. There's a lift to each floor, but the lift is TINY. It can barely fit 2 people in but we managed to squeeze ourselves in with 4 bags and couldn't move until the doors opened. The reception is small and overall the hotel looks gloomy as they do not like to turn on their lights. Maybe they like to save power? The staff are friendly and quite efficient. However, we were given a HORRIBLE room at first. Which we immediately rejected because we had stated we wanted a room facing the canal and this was confirmed by them. Then we got assigned the real proper room we were supposed to stay in. It faces the canal and the room stinks, but hey, you are in Venice. The deco is not my taste as it has really old furnishings, but the toilet is brand new and very tastefully done. The room also has a personal safe, but the safe IS NOT even secured in the cabinet. Hence, we did not use it at all. The HORRIBLE room I was talking about earlier however is really unsuitable for sleeping, if you get a not so nice room, DEMAND for a change. The location of this hotel cannot be beat after you find it of course. It is 5 minutes away from St Marks square and is quiet unless you open the window which will allow you to hear all the Gondolas passing by. Breakfast was decent, cornflakes and croissants as usual with some bread. The staff in the breakfast room are marvelous. Overall, a good stay, but for my next trip to Venice, I'll most likely stay along the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: LisaBella
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel. We were visiting northern Italy for a week and decided to take the train from Florence (Santa Maria Novella) to Venice for a one day/one night trip. We found this hotel on the TripAdvisor website and decided to try and get a room once we arrived in Venice (a short 3 hour trip by train). When we arrived we asked for a room for the night and recieved a fantastic deal! Lucky for us, there was a strike in Spain and several guests had cancelled their reservations for the night. We were able to get a great room (quite large by European standards) for only 103 euros! - what a deal - including a fantastic breakfast! The hotel lobby is very elegant and our room overlooked the small square outside the hotel. It is a very short walk to the Rialto water taxi stop and to piazza San Marco. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice stay in a quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjwills32
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, easy to find, and once there ideal for exploring venice. Restaurants nearby. The red room is in the attic, huge room with seating area, tv, big bathroom and the essential a/c. On the same floor as the breakfast room which provided an excellent start to the day with their continental breakfast. The staff were friendly and couldn't do enough to help if you needed assistance - would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul little hotel right by Saint Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: calumet
Reviews.Content: Just like all the reviews have said--a very clean, quiet and great hotel with a perfect location in Venice. The staff was very helpful and friendly and quickly answered all our e-mails prior to our visit. The continental breakfast was very nice--and the hot chocolate delicious. I would stay here again and they gave excellent directions for how to find the hotel from Saint Mark's Square. When we left It was a very easy water taxi ride to the stop where we were catching our cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenkel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights late June, had a few problems trying to find the hotel on foot, even now not quite sure how we found it, kind of stumbled across it, but think this is the norm when trying to find places in venice, if you are going on foot, take suitcase/bags with wheels. The room in the hotel was quite small, tiny bathroom, but very clean and nicely decorated, the breakfast was a continental style, nice breakfast room. The location is fantastic, small canal just yards away from the hotel, which we could see from our room, few mins to St Marks and few mins to Rialto bridge. All in all a good choice of hotel for a central location, not luxurious but comfortable, clean, modern, nicely decorated, spotless bathroom and the lift is great after all the walking you will be doing.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, location!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaEd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ca'del Campo along with another couple May 12 & 13, 2006. Based on a Tripadvisor review and desiring the top floor, we stayed in the red and green rooms. Same price ($290US) but quite different: Although the green room was spacious, except for a miniscule shower enclosure, the red room was at least twice the size with a large bath. The green room was adjacent and above a quiet courtyard, whereas the red was along the "street"(actually a walkway) frontage, but still quiet enough. I'd recommend the red room, unless you can get a deal on the smaller, but adequate green room. It was still early in the year and not too hot so we didn't use the airconditioning, but opened the nice Velux skylight windows: mistake as many mosquitos came in overnight. The second night we kept the windows closed and had no problems. We were later advised that we should have asked for some sort of mosquito repelling devices that they apparently offer. We were informed that screens don't exist in Venice? What a great location: 100 yards to San Marco, and 200 to the Rialto Bridge! We took the Alilaguna boat from the airport for 12 Euro's each, then schlepped our bags 300 or so flat yards to the hotel. Took a water taxi for 65 Euros total arranged by the hotel from within 30 feet of the hotel to the port for our cruise departure: Neat ride through the canals! A water taxi from the airport would have been worth it at even 100 Euros for the four of us to avoid looking for the hotel on foot with bags in toe. Great hotel with friendly staff, many of whom were conversant in English.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Book Goddess
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the deluxe rooms - in the attic The Red Room. WELL worth the extra money. Large, romantic and quiet. Well lit. Staff polite, but didn't know we could buy train tickets at Am. Express near by - pointed us to the train station instead. Great coffee. The bar on the corner is friendly. Location couldn't be better - unless you want it real quiet; then don't stay so close to San Marcos square. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TripadvisorUser
Reviews.Content: Great location, minutes to Piazza San Marco. The rooms are adequate, nothing spectacular, as is the breakfast. The staff could be friendlier, but the location and price make up for any lack of personality.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel. Situated close to St Marks, it is convenient and also it is not far to carry luggage to the water bus. Quiet at night. Staff friendly and they replied very quickly when we made enquiries and then the booking by email. The Green Room is in the attic but headroom is no problem, there is good space and it is comfortable. All the equipment in good working order. Breakfast typical continental: OK but not exciting. The lift is a big bonus. We also liked the Laguna Blu restaurant opposite: unpretentious but the food was good, price reasonable and the staff well above average for efficiency and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary in Venice at this hotel. Both the hotel and Venice were fantastic! Location of hotel was brilliant two minutes walk from St Mark's Square and five minutes from the Rialto bridge. Accommodation and hotel were spotlessly clean and staff were superb. Booked water taxi through reception for return journey to airport and they were cheaper than the agents - direct water bus cost 50 euros and water taxi cost 80 euros, worth the extra 30 euros! Visited on St Mark's Day and hotel even gave my wife a red rose in celebration! Best times to visit St Mark's Square is before 10.30am because of day trippers but don't miss St Mark's Square at night - very romantic as lit by hundreds of little lights! Would definitely visit Venice and this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel Lovely spacious rooms in a perfect location - close enough to pop back throughout the day from wherever you may be. Would also highly recommend the wine bar opposite the hotel - Cavatappi - lovely wines and fab food in a city where it can be difficult to find authentic, reasonably priced, Italian food. Would go back tomorrow (if only!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MartinWW1953
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel and all within 2 minutes or so of St Mark's Square. Hidden away but very clean and quiet with friendly staff and rooftop views of Venice from the top floor breakfast room. And all on the recommendation of our local Thompsons Travel Agent.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: xoxfordx
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; small, friendly, clean, great breakfast, AMAZING LOCATION! this is the best location for a hotel, nearby st marks and other beautiful sights, but not noisy at all at night PERFECT! we loved it, hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Reenyroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December, after reading the great reviews on trip advisor, and the hotel certainly lived up to everyone's comments.. the location is great - very close to St Mark's Square and not very far from the Rialto bridge either - a perfect base for exploring Venice. We stayed in the Green Room on the top floor - it was a very nice large and comfortable room, but you do have to be wary of the low angled ceiling / beams at times! Breakfast was good. Staff were polite, rooms were to a very good standard, we would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ca' del Campo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 511 | Campo della Guerra, 30124 Venice, Italy
